result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

CONDITIONS:
Huber Bailee Status
Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.
Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.

Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program under Level 4 supervision. 
CAM duration and/or drug testing frequency pursuant to Pretrial Supervision Program protocols. 
Defendant to pay costs associated with CAM and/or drug testing. 
Court bumps up to a level 4.

records.addlTxt:
Shawn N Woller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Deangelo Cressel Holmes in court, in custody, with attorney Douglas Michael Bihler (friend of the Court).
Court to Address:  Scheduling of Prelim or Waiver Hearing.

Defendant doesn't qualify for public defender representation.
Defendant is request the court appoint counsel.
Court swears in the defendant and conducts colloquy with the defendant.
Court Grants - Appointment of Counsel.

Court will specifically appoint Atty. Douglas Bihler at the rate of $100 per hour.
Defendant to post $100 per month, Court will order that the cash bail that was posted on case 21CF406 by applied to the attorney fees on this case and if a balance is still owed it will be paid as a condition of the sentence (Defendant currently has 3 OWI (4th) pending between here and Milwaukee County).     

Court conducts waiver of prelim colloquy with the defendant.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.
Bail as fixed.  Preliminary hearing waived, bound over.  Information filed, reading waived.  Hearing scheduled for April 28, 2022 at 09:00 am.
